task.title: Configuring SGSN support for deciphered Gb signaling for call trace
task.shortdesc: Use cipheringMode parameter in securityParam command, and cipherMode parameter in plmnParam command to configure 2G ciphering in the SGSN.

prereq.p: This feature does not need any specific configuration in order to decipher the Gb messages inside call trace.
As long as ciphering is enabled in the SGSN, the respective Gb messages are deciphered.
Reference for 2G ciphering activation shows below. For more information, see 2G ciphering GEA 1/2/3 (Features SG01009, SG01034, SG01175 and f60210-19).

info.p: The uplink messages are captured by the GIP after decryption and they are sent to the GTE in order to be reported in call trace.
The downlink messages are captured by the GGB before encryption and they are sent to the GTE in order to be reported in call trace.
info.note: In order to be able to see the deciphered messages in the Wireshark, “autodetect cipher bit” has to be configured in Wireshark preferences Edit PreferencesProtocolsGPRS-LLC.
